ai.seitok.flow

Interface Flow

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StringFlow

    public interface Flow
    The interface for working with command arguments. Command methods must accept a Flow type (or subtype).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasRemaining() 
      int index() 
      default java.lang.String next()
      Gets the argument as a string.
      default <T> T next(java.lang.Class<T> type)
      Get the next argument as a type of type.
      <T> T next(java.lang.Class<T> type, T def)
      Get the next argument as a type of type, returning def if it fails.
      default java.util.List<java.lang.String> remaining()
      Gets the remaining arguments as a, possibly empty, String List
      <T> java.util.List<T> remaining(java.lang.Class<T> type)
      Gets the remaining arguments as a, possibly empty, List

    • Method Detail

      • next

        default java.lang.String next()
        Gets the argument as a string. This is the same as calling next(String.class)
        Returns:
        the next argument as-is
        Throws:
        FlowEmptyException - If there are no remaining arguments.

      • next

        default <T> T next(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Get the next argument as a type of type. This is the same as calling next(type, null)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type for the next argument to be.
        Parameters:
        type - The type that the argument should be interpreted as
        Returns:
        The given argument as an object type of type
        Throws:
        FlowException - If the next argument failed to be interpreted
        FlowEmptyException - If there are no remaining arguments.

      • next

        <T> T next(java.lang.Class<T> type,
           T def)
        Get the next argument as a type of type, returning def if it fails.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type for the next argument to be.
        Parameters:
        type - The type that the argument should be interpreted as
        def - The default value that should be returned should the interpretation fail.
        Returns:
        The given argument as a type of type or def if it fails.
        Throws:
        FlowException - If the argument could not be interpreted AND def is null.
        FlowEmptyException - If there are no remaining arguments.

      • remaining

        default java.util.List<java.lang.String> remaining()
        Gets the remaining arguments as a, possibly empty, String List
        Returns:
        The remaining arguments as a String List

      • index

        int index()
        Returns:
        The current index of this Flow (typically the amount of arguments that have been processed so far)

      • remaining

        <T> java.util.List<T> remaining(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Gets the remaining arguments as a, possibly empty, List
        Type Parameters:
        T - The generic type to cast to
        Parameters:
        type - The type to cast to
        Returns:
        A list containing the remaining arguments as type T
        Throws:
        FlowException - If, at any point of processing, interpretation fails.

      • hasRemaining

        boolean hasRemaining()
        Returns:
        true if there are any elements remaining, false otherwise
